delay.description: fields to control the delay of the individual step, as this is set based on the parent strategy

requested_install_ids.description:
When a step is created, a set of installs are targeted. However, by the time the release step goes out, the
install might have been setup in any order of ways.

image_url.description: Image attributes, copied from a docker_buid or external_image component.

permissions.description: Permissions are used to track granular permissions for each domain

owner_id.description: parent can org, install or in the future, builtin runner group

aws_iam_role_arn.description: specific configuration for cloud specific runners, such as AWS or Azure

heart_beat_timeout.description: Various settings for the runner to handle internally

metadata.description: Metadata is used as both log and metric tags/attributes in the runner when emitting data

sandbox_mode.description: configuration for managing the runner server side

available_timeout.description: available timeout is how long a job can be marked as "available" before being requeued

execution_timeout.description: execution timeout is how long a job can be marked as "exeucuting" before being requeued

overall_timeout.description: overall timeout is how long a job can be attempted, before being cancelled

queue_timeout.description: queue timeout is how long a job can be queued, before being made available

actual.description:
Types that are assignable to Actual:

	*Plan_WaypointPlan
	*Plan_NoopPlan

use_sandbox_mode.description: These fields are used to control the behaviour of the org.

**NOTE** secrets can only be written, or deleted, not read.

get.description:
Return jsonschemas for Nuon configs. These can be used in frontmatter in most editors that have a TOML LSP (such as
[Taplo](https://taplo.tamasfe.dev/) configured.

```toml
#:schema https://api.nuon.co/v1/general/config-schema?source=inputs

description = "description"
```

You can pass in a valid source argument to render within a specific source file:

- input
- installer
- sandbox
- runner
- docker_build
- container_image
- helm
- terraform
- job

By default, the config expects that you are using multiple files and sources. If you are _not_, then pass the
`?flat=true` param.

parameters.description: return a schema for a source file
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: return a flat schema for the full app
parameters.name: flat
